column4: Hey, I'm just starting the upgrade to feisty and it's telling me that there's "no valid mirror". I'm using my ISP's mirror, which has 7.04 on there, last updated April 19th. Is it OK to continue?
the servers are a bit overwhelmed at the moment,  everybody and their goldfish is upgrading,  my suggestion wait a couple of days
That's why I want to use my ISP's mirror.
consider that your isp mirror might not be up to date yet
what is your videocard ?
Intel 855GM Integrated. It's in my notebook.
ok that sounds a bit odd,  look in menuy > system > admin > restricted drivers  try that to start with
My hardware does not need any restricted drivers.
ok   try the following command    sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
Went through the xserver reconfigure and restarted gdm and I'm still getting the same issue. I think my notebook may have finally kicked the bucket :\
is tis a recent problem or did is start after and upgrade or a fresh install ?
I went to sleep last night and it was all going fine, woke up this morning and it was stuffed.
did it hibernate ?
Blank screen. I have hibernate switched off.
segfaulting is one of those serious errors, it might be worth the trouble to reinstal ubuntu and not assume the lappy is dead yet
Mine's not segfaulting, who_cares is having the segfault problem ;)
oh, sorry ,   advice still applies,  try reinstlling just in case
OK, why not? Guess it can't get much worse :p Thanks for the help.
booting up the live cd should tell you if the screen is borked or if the instlled is
good point. I'll see if I can find it.
dl the .deb package directly from the mirror
ok, ta.
